issue.title: [Rust] publish new crate to work with stable toolchain
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-10576](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10576). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I've found all 3 version rust crate requires nightly toolchain, because arrow use feature(specialization), but recently

 ARROW-10002: [Rust] Remove trait specialization from arrow crate

already removed such requirement, can we publish new crate to work with stable toolchain ?

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10576?focusedCommentId=17232027) by Neville Dipale (nevi_me):*
Hi `[~comicfans]`, the Arrow project follows a release model, where the various language implementations are released together, often after a few months. The next release is likely to be between Jan and Feb 2021, and the arrow crate will indeed support stable (if not using features that require nightly) in that release.

Any opinions on this  `[~jorgecarleitao]`?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10576?focusedCommentId=17232240) by Jorge Leitão (jorgecarleitao):*
I do not think that stabilization is material for a patch release, and AFAIK releases to crate are considered official. Therefore, this needs to wait for the next release.

`[~comicfans]`, would pointing to a git hash in `Cargo.toml` help meanwhile?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10576?focusedCommentId=17332153) by Andrew Lamb (alamb):*
Migrated to github: https://github.com/apache/arrow-rs/issues/125
